name: auth_rls_initplan
title: Auth RLS Initialization Plan
description: Detects if calls to \`current_setting()\` and \`auth.<function>()\` in RLS policies are being unnecessarily re-evaluated for each row
detail: Table \`hotels.content\` has a row level security policy \`content_tenant_delete\` that re-evaluates current_setting() or auth.<function>() for each row. This produces suboptimal query performance at scale. Resolve the issue by replacing \`auth.<function>()\` with \`(select auth.<function>())\`. See [docs](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/postgres/row-level-security#call-functions-with-select) for more info.

name: multiple_permissive_policies
title: Multiple Permissive Policies
description: Detects if multiple permissive row level security policies are present on a table for the same \`role\` and \`action\` (e.g. insert). Multiple permissive policies are suboptimal for performance as each policy must be executed for every relevant query.
detail: Table \`public.airbnb_motopress_comparison\` has multiple permissive policies for role \`anon\` for action \`DELETE\`. Policies include \`{airbnb_motopress_comparison_access,airbnb_motopress_comparison_service_role,airbnb_motopress_comparison_tenant_isolation}\`

name: multiple_permissive_policies

description: Detects if multiple permissive row level security policies are present on a table for the same \`role\` and \`action\` (e.g. insert). Multiple permissive policies are suboptimal for performance as each policy must be executed for every relevant query.
detail: Table \`public.user_tenant_permissions\` has multiple permissive policies for role \`authenticator\` for action \`SELECT\`. Policies include \`{"Tenant admins can manage permissions","Users can view own permissions",user_tenant_permissions_select}\`
